meta_description: Explore the arts in Westchester County. We cover all the latest in theater, music, dance, visual art and more! Also Visit our gallery in downtown White Plains.
hours_text:
# Visit Us

We are excited to have you visit our renovated nine-story neo-classical bank building at 31 Mamaroneck Avenue in White Plains, NY. The historic building in the heart of the downtown not only serves as ArtsWestchester’s headquarters, it features a [2-story gallery space](https://artswestchester.org/programs/gallery/) that is free and open to the public.

**ARTSWESTCHESTER**  
31 Mamaroneck Avenue, 3rd Floor  
White Plains, NY 10601  
Tel: 914.428.4220 | Fax: 914.428.4306  
Office hours: Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm  
The Gallery is open 12-5pm Wednesday-Sunday during an exhibition. For a list of current and upcoming exhibitions, **[click here](https://artswestchester.org/programs/gallery/).**

Download directions by [clicking here](https://artswestchester.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/2016_ArtsWestchester.pdf).

Parking is conveniently located at The City Center parking garage with entrances on Main Street and Martine Avenue.  
Valet parking is also available at City Center garage(5pm-10pm) at the Mamaroneck Avenue entrance for a fee of $10.

* * *

admission_text:
#### To become an individual member, please click on “INDIVIDUAL” below the image on the left. Thank you!

As an ArtsWestchester Member, you’ll also be connected to Westchester’s arts community and receive various benefits. 

* * *

### Individual

Individual Membership is one of the most important ways for you to support arts and culture in Westchester County. With membership options to fit your lifestyle, supporting the arts has never been easier. Please select the level that works best for you! Join today and help to insure that arts education, local artists, and cultural programming continue to thrive in Westchester.

[](https://artswestchester.org/membership/individual-membership-2/)

### Cultural Organization

**Cultural Organization Membership** is available to non-profit groups in Westchester County that offer cultural programming. Through membership, your organization will have the opportunity to reach a larger audience by listing your events and other content on our site. **Join today** and share all your organization does to enrich the lives of our residents and visitors.

[](https://artswestchester.org/membership/membership-for-organizations/)

### Business

**Business Membership** is designed for small to large companies that believe the arts are a key component to economic growth in Westchester County. Through your membership, you are providing easy access to arts and cultural programming for your employees, their families and the community. **Join today** and b...
accessibility_text:
In a year when artists and cultural groups are [working harder than ever to keep creativity thriving](https://artswestchester.org/an-important-message-from-the-ceo-of-artswestchester/), new state support is on the way for Westchester and Rockland counties. The New York State Council on the Arts (NYSCA) has awarded **$349,578** to ArtsWestchester. This is funding that will help sustain local creators and cultural organizations through 2026 and 2027. NYSCA — whose mission is to foster and advance arts, culture and creativity throughout New York State — will distribute more than $161 million statewide in FY 2026, reaching organizations and artists across the state.

As ArtsWestchester CEO **Kathleen Reckling** explains, this latest award underscores the importance of statewide partnerships: “As a statewide community regrant partner with NYSCA, this award ensures that ArtsWestchester can support transformative creative projects in Westchester and Rockland counties in 2026 and 2027.” She adds that in a challenging year for the arts, the support “reaffirms New York State as a leader in fostering a vibrant arts and culture sector.”

State funding also plays a central role in ArtsWestchester’s **Arts Alive** grants, which have long provided a foundation for community-based work. **Erika Mallin** , Executive Director of NYSCA, emphasizes the broader significance of this investment: “We know this support isn’t just an investment in the arts; it’s an investment in New York’s future.”

# Discover the Arts in Westchester

With your support, we keep the arts alive and vibrant—discover art and culture near you.

[**View our Arts Picks**](https://artswestchester.org/arts-picks/) [**Get the Bi-Weekly E-Newsletter**](https://artswestchester.us2.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=79ab7eaf45352de3c6db670f0&id=e34cfde034)

This season, families have plenty of ways to celebrate across Westchester, with holiday events for kids that encourage creativity, curiosity and festive fun.
